place.name: NORTH LEVERTON
place.gazetteerText: LEVERTON (NORTH), a parish, with a village, in East Retford district, Notts; on the Retford and Lincoln railway, at Leverton r. station, 2½ miles W of the river Trent, and 5½ E of East Retford. Post town, South leverton, under Retford. Acres, 1,050. Real property, £2,593. Pop., 329. Houses, 79. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to G. S. Foljambe, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £200. Patron, the Bishop of Manchester. The church is old but good, and has a tower. Charities £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
